channel.title: visual reasoning on The AI Talks
channel.description: Recent content in visual reasoning on The AI Talks

item.title: TBD
item.description: Speaker Jack Hessel is a Research Scientist at the Allen Institute for AI. He previously earned a PhD from Cornell. These days, he works on improving human-AI collaboration. This includes aligning model behavior with human intent (RLHF), and expanding language models with new modalities (e.g., vision) for a more complete view of the world. Abstract Algorithms that can jointly process modalities like images+text are needed for next generation search, accessibility, and robot interaction tools.
